refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Matlab and Scilab subtraction behave differently in some particular cases:

listitem.para: With character string operands: The - operator can not be used into Scilab with character strings, while Matlab realizes the subtraction of the operands ASCII codes.

With empty matrix: In Scilab, if one of the operands is an empty matrix the result of the subtraction is the other operand. In Matlab if one of the operand is an empty matrix the result of the subtraction should be an error or an empty matrix.

refsection.para: The function mtlb_s(A,B) is used by mfile2sci to replace A-B when it was not possible to know what were the operands while porting Matlab code to Scilab. This function will determine the correct semantic at run time. If you want to have a more efficient code it is possible to replace mtlb_s calls:

listitem.para: If A and B are character strings, mtlb_s(A,B) may be replaced by asciimat(A)-asciimat(B)
If both A and B are not empty matrices mtlb_s(A,B) may be replaced by A-B, else mtlb_s(A,B) may be replaced by [].
If mtlb_mode()==%T, then mtlb_s(A,B) may be replaced by A-B in any case where A and B are not character string matrices.

para.warning: Caution: mtlb_s has not to be used for hand coded functions.
